sentences: Tema suu oli väike ja nina terava.
context: The word 'suu' is a common Estonian noun meaning 'mouth'. It follows the ÕS type 26i/idee declension pattern and has various case forms including genitive (suu), partitive (suud), illative (suusse), inessive (suus), elative (suust), adessive (suul), ablative (suult), etc. The word is cognate with Finnish 'suu' and Hungarian 'száj', all originating from Proto-Uralic *śuwe.
